channel.title: 2 Questions! Slight Experience Needed!
channel.description:
Ok Hey Guys! :)
I've Been Working On A Devolution Server Source 7.0 For A Few Months And Im Just Making The Finishing Touches. And I Was Wondering 2 Simple Things That Have Never Occured To Me Until Now. Although I Don't Really Need To Know There Things For What I'm Doing It Would Really Help If Ever Needed Later On.
1) How Do I Add Objects?
2) How Do I Give Item When Reach Level 99 In A Skill?
Since I Have No Experience In These Subjects Step By Step Instructions Will Be Needed As Of What To Search And Where To Add :P
In Addition I Was Also Wondering About A Reasonably Compilcated Subject.
3) Making Potions Work
Im More Worried About Questions One And Two But This Would Really Help. To Avoid Too Much Trouble I've Decided To Just Make It Give Permanent Xp For A Skill. This Is What I Have So Far:
case 2428: addSkillXP(800, 17); removeitem code (i dont know it...) Break;
All Help Would Be Appreciated On These Topics But Don't Answer If Your Too Busy :P
Thanx Guys.
Ps. Please Avoid Posting Useless Comments That Won't Help Me At All. :P

item.title: 2 Questions! Slight Experience Needed!
item.dc:creator: @slim_2021 slim_2021
item.description:
@slim_2021 wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:12, topic:169808”][quote author=slim_2021 link=topic=229598.msg1968753#msg1968753 date=1199213161]
to add the items when you get 99 try searching for congratulations, lol its what i used, in client.java and add this under NpcDialogueSend = true;

well thats where it is on mine anyways, if youve been working on it that long you should be able to figure out where to put it, lol

if (playerLevel[0] >= 99) {
addItem(####, #);
addItem(####, #);
sendMessage(“Congratulations, you just recived (item here)!”);

####=item id
#=amount

[/quote]

that wont work, that jsut says “if this person has 99 attack give them this stuff” it doesnt say when to give it.[/quote]

if it is added in the correct location it will only give it once the player reaches level 99.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Questions! Slight Experience Needed!
item.dc:creator: @_Kaos [Kaos]
item.description:
@_Kaos wrote:

You should really use a void to handle the objects.

Declare this void,

public void give99item() { if(playerLevel[LvlID] > 99){ addItem(ItemID, 1); } }
Then put,

give99item();

Under public boolean process() .
Use that for all the skills. Just change “LvlID” to the level Id. Also change ItemID to the item ID of the item you want to give them with.

Hope that helps.

Read full topic

level.");

addItem(4323, 1);
sendMessage(“Congratulations, you just recived An Attack Skill Cape!”);
break;

	case 1:

		sendFrame164(6206);
		sendFrame126(
				"Congratulations, you just advanced a strength

level!",

case 1
^

2 errors[/quote]

you need to add a bracket right here

sendMessage(“Congratulations, you just recived An Attack Skill Cape!”);
} <--------------right here, lol
break;

item.title: 2 Questions! Slight Experience Needed!
item.dc:creator: @akanaz akanaz
item.description:
@akanaz wrote:

I Found Case 121 This Is What I Found Could You Please Tell Me What To Do From Here 

	case 121:
		replaceDoors();
		if (heightLevel == 0) {
			ReplaceObject2(2613, 3084, 3994, -3, 11);
			ReplaceObject2(2628, 3151, 2104, -3, 11);
			ReplaceObject2(2629, 3151, 2105, -3, 11);
			ReplaceObject2(2733, 3374, 6420, -1, 11);
			// ReplaceObject2(2691, 9774, 2107, 0, 11);
		}[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 01, 2008, 07:47:41 AM[/size][hr]Slim That Is Alot Of Help I'd Like To Thank You And I Really Appreciate It :)
